list_definition.definition: a paper cover for a sweet, packet of cigarettes etc

list_ex_of_english: The higher denominations franked wrappers of bundles of newspapers and were frequently discarded.
Other examples were quoted, including what appeared to be bars of chocolate in a sweet-shop window but were in reality chocolate wrappers put around blocks of wood.
When she is not found reading a book, she can be found reading candy wrappers, coupons and old receipts.
The disposal of hay and straw used in packing imported goods, and of imported meat wrappers and containers, is also regulated.
Interoperability between agents is ensured by a wrapper.
If we put the punnets into cellophane wrappers the strawberries deteriorate, and we are worse off than we were.
Following a few cases of delay in delivery the wrappers enclosing the mail are now being specially marked.
